SENT.plain: Topotecan has demonstrable activity in high-risk MDS and CMMoL
However, the significant toxicity of topotecan administered at a dose of 2mg/m2 i.v. daily for 5 days as a continuous infusion limits its use in older patients
Therefore, we studied topotecan 1.5mg/m2 per day i.v. over 2 h for three consecutive days in 20 patients with high-risk MDS (12 RAEB; 4 RAEB-T; 4 CMMoL)
Fifteen patients were evaluable for response
Only one patient achieved a durable complete remission (CR)
There were three deaths within the first cycle of therapy
Severe myelosuppression was the most common toxicity
Grades 3-4 infections were documented in four patients
We conclude that topotecan administered at this dose and schedule has no clinically significant activity
